Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the "Fish and Fiber Study" as outlined in the consent form?
A) The study is a routine medical treatment for existing conditions.
B) The study is a research project designed to understand the effects of fish oil and fiber on the human body.
C) The study is a commercial product trial for a new dietary supplement.
D) The study is a personal fitness program focusing on diet and exercise.

Correct answer: B) The study is a research project designed to understand the effects of fish oil and fiber on the human body.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the "Fish and Fiber" research study?
A) To test the effectiveness of a new colonoscopy technique
B) To understand the individual effects of fish oil and fiber on the human body
C) To explore the combined effect of fish oil and fiber on colon health and potential cancer prevention
D) To compare the benefits of corn oil to fish oil on cardiovascular health

Correct answer: C

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected total duration of participation for each subject in the Fish and Fiber study?
A) 2 months; B) 4 months; C) 6 months; D) 1 year

Correct answer: B) 4 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
What will happen with any potential additional costs incurred by participating in the "Fish and Fiber" study?
A) The study will cover all additional costs.
B) You or your health insurance will have to pay for any additional costs.
C) The study will reimburse travel expenses.
D) There are no extra costs for being in this study.

Correct answer: D) There are no extra costs for being in this study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following is a correct summary of the procedures you will need to follow if you participate in the Fish and Fiber study?

A) You will only need to take the study supplements for 15 days each period and provide blood and stool samples at the beginning of each period.
B) You will take the study supplements every day for 30 days each period, come to the center for blood draws at the beginning and end of each period, and collect stool samples at the beginning, middle, and end of each period.
C) You will be required to stay at the research center for the duration of the 30-day study periods to ensure compliance with the supplement regimen.
D) You will take the study supplements once a week for 30 weeks and submit to a single comprehensive health examination at the end of the study.

Correct answer: B) You will take the study supplements every day for 30 days each period, come to the center for blood draws at the beginning and end of each period, and collect stool samples at the beginning, middle, and end of each period.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the Fish and Fiber study at any point after joining?
A) You will be required to pay a penalty for early withdrawal; B) Your regular medical care will be affected; C) Previously collected information will remain in the study records and cannot be removed; D) You will be prohibited from participating in future research studies at Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to enroll in the Fish and Fiber study?
A) 20; B) 30; C) 40; D) 50
Correct answer: C

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are some of the potential risks or discomforts associated with participating in the "Fish and Fiber" study?
A) Temporary bruising from blood draws and mild bloating from fiber supplements
B) Severe allergic reactions to the placebo supplements
C) Long-term digestive issues due to changes in diet
D) Increased risk of developing colon cancer

Correct answer: A

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What potential benefits are associated with participating in the "Fish and Fiber" study?

A) Direct personal health benefits from the supplements provided.
B) Financial compensation for participation in the study.
C) Guaranteed prevention of colon cancer in the future.
D) Contributing to research that may help in the prevention of colon cancer in the future.

Correct answer: D) Contributing to research that may help in the prevention of colon cancer in the future.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What alternative options are available to you if you choose not to participate in the Fish and Fiber study?
A) You can opt for a standard medical check-up without any dietary intervention; B) You will be provided with a different set of dietary supplements for personal use; C) You will be enrolled in a different study focusing on exercise and colon health; D) No alternative options are provided as the study is not related to your regular medical care.

Correct answer: D

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your personal information will be handled in the Fish and Fiber study?
A) Your personal information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your personal information will be kept confidential, but may be disclosed if required by law or for research verification purposes.
C) All your personal information, including your name and contact details, will be published alongside the study results.
D) The study will not collect any personal information, so confidentiality is not a concern.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What does the consent form state regarding compensation for research-related injuries in the Fish and Fiber Study?
A) The study will provide full compensation for any research-related injuries.
B) The study will provide free medical treatment for any research-related injuries.
C) Participants or their health insurance will have to pay for treatment of any research-related injuries, and there are no funds to compensate for such injuries.
D) Participants will receive a stipend to cover any potential medical costs related to research-related injuries.

Correct answer: C) Participants or their health insurance will have to pay for treatment of any research-related injuries, and there are no funds to compensate for such injuries.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form say about your ability to withdraw from the "Fish and Fiber" study?

A) You may withdraw at any time, but you will incur a penalty.
B) You cannot withdraw once you have started the study.
C) You may withdraw at any time without any penalty or loss of benefits you are otherwise entitled to.
D) Withdrawing from the study will result in a loss of medical care benefits.

Correct answer: C) You may withdraw at any time without any penalty or loss of benefits you are otherwise entitled to.
